content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
• Burner Inserter at Position(-3.5, 27.5) with drop position Position(-3.5, 28.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
• Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(2.5, 17.5).
• Burner Inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) (placed with direction RIGHT adjacent to the input chest).
• Burner Inserter at Position(1.5, 17.5) linked through neighbour connections to the chest and production unit.
• Assembling Machine at Position(1.5, 19.5) for copper‐cable production.

### Belt Depot at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest placed at Position(3.5, 15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot.
• Transport Belt Segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) adjoining the depot chest.
• Depot Burner Inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) (set with direction UP) to receive items from the belt segment.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Belt Connection Errors (Repeated in Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, 217)
 – When connecting multi‐segment transport belts, the target entity must be a valid inserter and not a steam engine. Ensure that an inserter is added to input items into a steam engine rather than connecting a belt directly to it.

• Entity Placement Distance Issue
 – When encountering placement errors due to maximum distance (e.g. target chest at (3.5,15.5) being too far from the player’s position), move closer to the target position prior to placement.

• Inventory and Undefined Variable Errors
 – If an entity cannot be placed because it is not present in the inventory (such as the wooden chest missing after an attempted placement), verify and update the inventory before placement.
 – Resolve NameError issues (e.g. ‘target_chest’ is not defined) by ensuring the correct variable name is used and that it has been properly assigned.
